snippet: Months after reaching an agreement with the Justice Department to transform its troubled police department, New Orleans wants out of the deal, saying it’s too expensive.
abstract: New Orleans, months after reaching agreement with Justice Department to transform its troubled police department, wants out of deal, saying it is too expensive; much remains unclear, but roots of breakdown seem to lie in effort clean up city jails.
lead_paragraph: Months after reaching an agreement with the Justice Department to transform its troubled police department, New Orleans wants out of the deal, saying it’s too expensive.

headline.seo: Once Partners, New Orleans and Washington Now Fight Over Police Decree
headline.main: A New Orleans-Washington Handshake Turns to Fists
headline.print_headline: A New Orleans-Washington Handshake Turns to Fists
